title: Google\Cloud\Dataproc\V1\GceClusterConfig
name: GceClusterConfig
description:
Common config settings for resources of Compute Engine cluster instances, applicable to all instances in the cluster.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.dataproc.v1.GceClusterConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.zone_uri
params.description: Optional. The zone where the Compute Engine cluster will be located. On a create request, it is required in the "global" region. If omitted in a non-global Dataproc region, the service will pick a zone in the corresponding Compute Engine region. On a get request, zone will always be present. A full URL, partial URI, or short name are valid. Examples: https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/[project_id]/zones/[zone] projects/[project_id]/zones/[zone] * us-central1-f

params.name: data.network_uri
params.description: Optional. The Compute Engine network to be used for machine communications. Cannot be specified with subnetwork_uri. If neither network_uri nor subnetwork_uri is specified, the "default" network of the project is used, if it exists. Cannot be a "Custom Subnet Network" (see Using Subnetworks for more information). A full URL, partial URI, or short name are valid. Examples: https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/[project_id]/regions/global/default projects/[project_id]/regions/global/default * default

params.name: data.subnetwork_uri
params.description: Optional. The Compute Engine subnetwork to be used for machine communications. Cannot be specified with network_uri. A full URL, partial URI, or short name are valid. Examples: https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/[project_id]/regions/us-east1/subnetworks/sub0 projects/[project_id]/regions/us-east1/subnetworks/sub0 * sub0

params.name: data.internal_ip_only
params.description: Optional. If true, all instances in the cluster will only have internal IP addresses. By default, clusters are not restricted to internal IP addresses, and will have ephemeral external IP addresses assigned to each instance. This internal_ip_only restriction can only be enabled for subnetwork enabled networks, and all off-cluster dependencies must be configured to be accessible without external IP addresses.

params.name: data.private_ipv6_google_access
params.description: Optional. The type of IPv6 access for a cluster.

params.name: data.service_account
params.description: Optional. The Dataproc service account (also see VM Data Plane identity) used by Dataproc cluster VM instances to access Google Cloud Platform services. If not specified, the Compute Engine default service account is used.

params.name: data.service_account_scopes
params.description: Optional. The URIs of service account scopes to be included in Compute Engine instances. The following base set of scopes is always included: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud.useraccounts.readonly https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.read_write https://www.googleapis.com/auth/logging.write If no scopes are specified, the following defaults are also provided: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigquery https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigtable.admin.table https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigtable.data * https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control

params.name: data.tags
params.description: The Compute Engine tags to add to all instances (see Tagging instances).

params.name: data.metadata
params.description: The Compute Engine metadata entries to add to all instances (see Project and instance metadata).

params.name: data.reservation_affinity
params.description: Optional. Reservation Affinity for consuming Zonal reservation.

params.name: data.node_group_affinity
params.description: Optional. Node Group Affinity for sole-tenant clusters.

params.name: data.shielded_instance_config
params.description: Optional. Shielded Instance Config for clusters using Compute Engine Shielded VMs.

params.name: data.confidential_instance_config
params.description: Optional. Confidential Instance Config for clusters using Confidential VMs.

methods.name: getZoneUri
methods.description:
Optional. The zone where the Compute Engine cluster will be located.

On a create request, it is required in the "global" region. If omitted in a non-global Dataproc region, the service will pick a zone in the corresponding Compute Engine region. On a get request, zone will always be present. A full URL, partial URI, or short name are valid. Examples:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/[project_id]/zones/[zone]
  • projects/[project_id]/zones/[zone]
  • us-central1-f

Generated from protobuf field string zone_uri = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.description:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/[project_id]/zones/[zone]
  • projects/[project_id]/zones/[zone]
  • us-central1-f

Generated from protobuf field string zone_uri = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.name: getNetworkUri
methods.description:
Optional. The Compute Engine network to be used for machine communications. Cannot be specified with subnetwork_uri. If neither network_uri nor subnetwork_uri is specified, the "default" network of the project is used, if it exists. Cannot be a "Custom Subnet Network" (see Using Subnetworks for more information).

A full URL, partial URI, or short name are valid. Examples:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/compute/v1/projects/[project_id]/regions/global/default
  • projects/[project_id]/regions/global/default
  • default

methods.name: getInternalIpOnly
methods.description:
Optional. If true, all instances in the cluster will only have internal IP addresses. By default, clusters are not restricted to internal IP addresses, and will have ephemeral external IP addresses assigned to each instance. This internal_ip_only restriction can only be enabled for subnetwork enabled networks, and all off-cluster dependencies must be configured to be accessible without external IP addresses.

methods.name: getServiceAccount
methods.description:
Optional. The Dataproc service account (also see VM Data Plane identity) used by Dataproc cluster VM instances to access Google Cloud Platform services.

If not specified, the Compute Engine default service account is used.

Generated from protobuf field string service_account = 8 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.description:

params.name: var
params.description:
Optional. The Dataproc service account (also see VM Data Plane identity) used by Dataproc cluster VM instances to access Google Cloud Platform services.

If not specified, the Compute Engine default service account is used.

methods.name: getServiceAccountScopes
methods.description:
Optional. The URIs of service account scopes to be included in Compute Engine instances. The following base set of scopes is always included:

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud.useraccounts.readonly
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.read_write
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/logging.write If no scopes are specified, the following defaults are also provided:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigquery
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigtable.admin.table
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigtable.data
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control

Generated from protobuf field repeated string service_account_scopes = 3 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.read_write
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/logging.write If no scopes are specified, the following defaults are also provided:
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigquery
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigtable.admin.table
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/bigtable.data
  • https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control
